intro: Oonopsis, commonly known as the white thornapple, is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves, which are typical of many species in this family. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale blue in color. Oonopsis is native to parts of South America and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its fruit, a rough, spiny capsule, contains seeds that are dispersed by wind or animals.
